catalog_info.title: Principles of Toxicology
catalog_info.notes: Offered jointly with the School of Public Health as EH 504.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Organic chemistry and mammalian physiology or equivalent.
catalog_info.description: Emphasizes mechanisms of injury and clinical consequences following exposures to environmental and occupational chemicals. Examines actions at the molecular, cellular, organ system, and organismal levels. Discusses methods for detecting, evaluating, analyzing, and combating toxic effects.
